| ( [![Harp.png](/images/4/4e/Harp.png)](/wiki/File:Harp.png) |                                  |
| ----------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
| Name                                                        | magic harp                       |
| Appearance                                                  | [harp](/wiki/Harp "Harp")        |
| Base price                                                  | 50 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") |
| Weight                                                      | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")      |
| Material                                                    | [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood")        |
| Monster use                                                 | *Will not be used by monsters.*  |

A **magic harp** is a type of [magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") [musical instrument](/wiki/Musical_instrument "Musical instrument") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [tonal](/wiki/Tonal "Tonal") and made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood"), and appears as just a [harp](/wiki/Harp "Harp") when unidentified.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.3 DynaHack](#DynaHack)
  - [6.4 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [6.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Magic harps are created with 1–8 charges.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a magic harp with [charges](/wiki/Charge "Charge") [tames](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [monsters](/wiki/Monsters "Monsters") around [you](/wiki/You "You") and [exercises](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") your [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Applying a magic harp with no charges left produces the same effects as a normal [wooden harp](/wiki/Wooden_harp "Wooden harp"), exercising dexterity and pacifying nearby [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") with a dexterity-based chance.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) The radius of effect for a charged magic harp depends on your [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

.........  
...858...  
..23032..  
.8341438.  
.501\@105.  
.8341438.  
..23032..  
...858...  
.........

Mouse over to see the minimum experience level required for the effect of a magic harp to affect that square. Red corresponds to levels 1-9, blue to XL 10-19, and green to XL 20-29.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit 231bd75](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/231bd75b7f5ddc3ef0f745a75ea3566cc4055d99), magic harp taming works the same as the read non-cursed [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming") and the [spell of charm monster](/wiki/Spell_of_charm_monster "Spell of charm monster"), and may increase the tameness of already-tame monsters. Additionally, [commit 094da9b](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/094da9b983a1dbbe171946a7cee32e565c59245b) allows magic harps to properly pacify angry shopkeepers.

The magic harp can be charged an unlimited number of times; it gains 1d4 charges with an uncursed scroll of charging, or 2d4 with a blessed scroll, and can hold a maximum of 20 charges.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Strategy

The magic harp is a valuable tool for taming and pacifying monsters and operates at the same range as a non-cursed scroll of taming at experience level 4; this potentially saves [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") ink on writing a [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). It can also be easily distinguished from a wooden harp by playing one or the other, especially near a monster. However, while it can affect monsters at a further range than the scroll of taming, it pales in comparison to reading the non-cursed scroll while confused.

As a tonal instrument, a magic harp can also be used to play the [passtune](/wiki/Passtune "Passtune") to enter the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The magic harp's ability to increase tameness can be used to make [inediate](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate") pets more viable, as their apport typically cannot be raised by feeding them.

## History

The magic harp first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Messages

- For messages from playing a magic harp with no charges, see [the section](/wiki/Wooden_harp#Messages "Wooden harp") in the wooden harp article.

- The harp produces very attractive music.

  You applied a magic harp with charges and improvised with it.

- You extract a strange sound from the magic harp!

  As above, but you played a specific melody with the harp.

- You feel very soothing vibrations.

  You applied a magic harp while [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf").

## Variants

In variants that import the [advent calendar](/wiki/Advent_calendar "Advent calendar") patch, a magic harp is among the various items that may appear as the Christmas present on day 24.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a wooden harp can be [upgraded](/wiki/Upgraded "Upgraded") into a magic harp.

### dNetHack

In dNetHack, the [Troubadour](/wiki/Troubadour "Troubadour") role starts with knowledge of the magic harp and all other musical instruments. Their [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), [The Lyre of Orpheus](/wiki/The_Lyre_of_Orpheus "The Lyre of Orpheus"), is an neutral [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") magic harp that can be used to play any song via the musicalize spell [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"); it grants [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") when carried, causes all pets on the level to follow you between levels, and can be applied or [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") for taming. Each time it is applied or invoked, the Lyre will speak a random rumor dependent on its beatitude: the rumor will be true if the Harp is blessed, false if cursed, and either if uncursed.

### DynaHack

In [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), applying a magic harp will formally [identify](/wiki/Identify "Identify") it.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [sylph](/wiki/Sylph_\(starting_race\) "Sylph (starting race)") [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") start each game with a magic harp.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") includes the Troubador role (known in SlashTHEM as the Bard), which retains knowledge of the magic harp and all other musical instruments; The Lyre of Orpheus is now a wooden harp.

[Musicians](/wiki/Musician "Musician") start each game with a magic harp among their magical instruments; their quest artifact, The [Harp of Harmony](/index.php?title=Harp_of_Harmony\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Harp of Harmony (page does not exist)"), is a lawful artifact magic harp that grants [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), and [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") while carried, and can be applied or [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") for taming. When applied or invoked, the Harp will speak a random rumor based on its beatitude: true if blessed, false if cursed, and either if uncursed.

The [Harp of Lightning](/index.php?title=Harp_of_Lightning\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Harp of Lightning (page does not exist)"), the [Electric Mage](/wiki/Electric_Mage "Electric Mage") quest artifact, is a neutral artifact magic harp that grants [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") and [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") while carried, and can be invoked to summon a tame [air elemental](/wiki/Air_elemental "Air elemental") (or sometimes a [greater air elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_air_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater air elemental (page does not exist)")).

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 620](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L620)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 630](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L630)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 631](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L631): *The sum of your [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") and a randomly rolled number between 0 and your current dexterity stat must exceed 25*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 686](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L686)
